titlestmt.titleproper: Genealogical Society of Pennsylvania Bibliographical Records Committee records 1928-1929
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Genealogical Society of Pennsylvania Bibliographical Records Committee records
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: In the 1920s the Genealogical Society of Pennsylvania conducted a statewide survey of county historical societies seeking church records, meeting records, genealogies, bible records, diaries, journals, account books, and music.

scopecontent.p: The collection is comprised of three binders containing committee reports and minutes for the Bibliographical Records Committee. In addition to the reports and minutes, there is correspondence to and from M. Atherton Leach with other historical organizations and libraries gathering information on the records in their possession, and a small number of papers on historical topics, particularly music. The collection includes a small number of photographs of cemeteries.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
